summary: The Global Tech Startup meeting focused on finalizing the Q4 strategy and product roadmap, encompassing product development, marketing plans, and strategic partnerships. Key updates included completing 75% of mobile app development with an AI-powered recommendation system, and a security audit for API integration to be done by November 30th. The team established a launch timeline for December 1st (beta), December 8th (soft), and December 15th (official release), while adjusting the $200,000 marketing budget to increase Vietnam's allocation and approving the hiring of three new developers for the China team. Crucially, the company decided to accept TechCorp's investment offer of $500,000 for 10% equity, with the contract set to be finalized by November 25th.

topics.description: Discussion on the progress of mobile app development (iOS ready for beta, Android needs two more weeks), backend API integration, and security audit completion. The team also decided to add an AI-powered recommendation system. A launch timeline was set: Beta launch on December 1st, soft launch on December 8th, and official launch on December 15th.

Maria presented Q4 marketing campaigns for 5 markets (USA, Vietnam, China, Spain, Brazil) with an initial total budget of $200,000. The budget was adjusted to increase Vietnam's allocation to $40,000 and decrease USA's to $70,000. Plans for collaborating with 10 influencers were also discussed.

Discussion regarding investment offers from TechCorp ($500,000 for 10% equity) and InnovateLabs ($300,000 for 8% equity). The team decided to accept TechCorp's offer due to their strong network in Asian markets, with David finalizing the contract by November 25th.

Zhang Wei proposed hiring 3 additional developers for the China team to manage the heavy workload and accelerate feature delivery. The proposal was approved, with hiring to be completed by December 15th.
